title: "What are the different types of attention and nonverbal aspects in coaching?"
first_phrase: This text describes different types of attention and brain waves that occur during a coaching session. The first four types of attention are: linear attention, expanded attention, beta waves attention, and alpha waves attention. The latter two correspond to rumination and creative reflection, while gamma waves attention indicates insight. The physiological excitement occurs when recalling past experiences and can signal an openness to new solutions. The text provides a detailed illustration of how these attention moments can alternate during a coaching session. In the last 200 tokens, the article describes the non-verbal and verbal aspects of a coaching session and the initial phases of a coaching session when both the coach and the participant are relaxed.

last_phrase: In conclusion, during a coaching session, various non-verbal cues can help in identifying different mental states and progress. The movement of pupils in different directions, defocused gaze, and being lost in thought showcases attention, creative reflection, and insight. The recall of past events can also evoke physiological excitement. Understanding these non-verbal aspects can aid both the coach and coachee in achieving new solutions and overcoming old patterns.
